name: Airport Madness: World Edition
description: Insanely addictive, easy to learn, impossible to master! Airport Madness is an airport strategy game. Designed by real air traffic controllers, Airport Madness captures the fun aspects of air traffic control. The decisions and actions you make in this game are identical to real-world airport ops.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 (32/64 bit) Processor: 1.0 GHZ Memory: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 8.0 Storage: 100 MB available space

For everyone mentioning 'Kennedy Approach' in their reviews - thank you! Kennedy Approach was one of my all time fav game on the C64. So I got this. Airport Madness is very close to KA's gameplay. Easy to pickup, good pace, voice/sound effects are there, and things can get very hectic. Happy I got this one.
Fun game that lies between a sim and arcade game. Not as deep or long as previous titles in the series, but a worthy entry nonetheless.

This is the first time I've actually bought an Airport Madness game, however, I did play the demo of Airport Madness 4 online a lot. It was odd that this version took out the ability to set the traffic level from 1(lowest) to 10(holy crap! Mid-air traffic jams). The only way to set the traffic is in endless mode and even then you only have 3 options. I'd really like to see an update where there is a custom game setting. A option where you pick an airport, set how many planes you want to sucsessfuly land, set the traffic volume and set how many crashes you're allowed before a game over. That's what was missing in this game. I also would not mind if the maps were a little bit larger because it does get a tad crowded, I know that's the point, however, I'd really like more room for delaying flights. So, would I buy this game again? Well, I thought it over and then notived I'd already played it for 85 minutes in one sitting. After realizing that, yes I would buy it again. It's fun and fast paced. The feel and look of the game is great. It goes for the kind of style that is the most fun to the player rather than a realistic radar using controller. I like that because the game would be dull if it was realistic. It's a great little game, but, it is a bit pricey. I waited for the game to be 25% off and that made it worth my money (or lack there-of). I wont give the game a numerical rating since I don't think I could properly explain it. However, I would buy it again even as it is right now. But, I really home Bigfatsimulations considers my ideas.

Isn't that bad game to lose some time, but I can't find any overall appealing. It's just dull queue management simulator and I think I paid more than I should. Feels like a 0.99 iPad/iPhone game.  It can be improved to make things more interesting.
It was fun once, but since the developer looks like have already abandoned this game, I'm just disappointed that I had wasted my money.

All in all a nice casual ATC Sim - however there are some things missing or outright a bad design choice. E.g. you do not have the option to give the order 'go around', on the Vancouver map the following rwy setup is active and cannot be changed: 13,31,26L,26R - 13 is pretty much exactly opposite of every other active, no ATC in their right mind would have that configuration.  I have defenitly seen better.  Therefore I cannot recommend this game - if you actually wish to play a decent one give Tower! 2011 a try (this is however not available on Steam).
Thought Funchal was going suspiciously easy, ended up recreating the Tenerife Airport Disaster. 10/10

Great game ... it killed all the free time I had for a couple days. It's not the graphics, it's not the 'realistic gameplay' it is just the fun it makes and the challanges you will clear, if you once started! Well, I would not recommend this game for everyone, but if you like casual games, which ask fast reaction to different situations and like planes/ATC: BUY IT!!!  I will buy also the 3D-Version which will come in 2016 ... hopefully we will get another ATC3-likely-game! =)
This is exactly what I have been looking for in air traffic control! Thank you very much! Keep up the good work! Add more cities.

Airpor Madness gives you the satisfaction of managing a real airport and keeping planes from crashing with each other while having very simple mechanics because all you need to do is look around the screen and use the mouse. Trying to land 100 airplanes is not easy even at an airport with a single runway.
